name: market for pig iron | pig iron | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22627/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'pig iron', in the Global geography.;This activity represents the global supply of pig iron (hot metal) to steelmaking plants.;Transport distances are based on the ecoinvent "Default Transport Assumptions" model, accessible on the ecoinvent website.

At the gate of the blast furnace plant.

At the gate of the steelmaking plant.
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/241:Manufacture of basic iron and steel/2410:Manufacture of basic iron and steel

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Activity represents the supply of iron ore concentrate globally.

exchanges.description:
The total marine transport volume differentiated into major commodity groups based on data from FearnResearch (2001): Fearnley's Annual Review 2000. Oslo: Fearnley/AS, p. 1-78. The category “Other cargo” accounts for 38% of total maritime transport volume and has been distributed on commodity groups based on the proportions of transport by rail and inland waterways.
The total marine transport volume differentiated into major commodity groups based on data from FearnResearch (2001): Fearnley's Annual Review 2000. Oslo: Fearnley/AS, p. 1-78. The category “Other cargo” accounts for 38% of total maritime transport volume and has been distributed on commodity groups based on the proportions in the marine import and export of the US in 2001-2010.
